item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, March 25, 2025 at 12:35 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Spammers are better at SPF, DKIM, and DMARC than everyone else (133 points | 61 comments)
2. Closing Keynote with Leslie Lamport at Scale 22x: Coding Isn't Programming (37 points | discuss)
3. German parliament votes as a Git contribution graph (435 points | 132 comments)
4. Writing your own C++ standard library from scratch (76 points | 52 comments)
5. Search My Site – open-source search engine for personal and independent websites (141 points | 38 comments)
6. Status as a Service (2019) (43 points | 23 comments)
7. Palantir suggests 'common operating system' for UK govt data (25 points | 20 comments)
8. Qwen2.5-VL-32B: Smarter and Lighter (482 points | 244 comments)
9. The Great Barefoot Running Hysteria of 2010 (83 points | 77 comments)
10. Triforce – a beamformer for Apple Silicon laptops (539 points | 200 comments)
11. Reflecting on WikiTok (70 points | 12 comments)
12. WWI's 'Dazzle' Camouflage Seemed Effective Due to Unexpected Optical Trick (82 points | 46 comments)
13. The Lost Towers of the Guelph-Ghibelline Wars (45 points | 21 comments)
14. A study reveals that deciduous trees' roots remain active in winter (17 points | 7 comments)
15. Closing the Chapter on OpenH264 (12 points | 1 comment)
16. Three Hundred Years Later, a Tool from Isaac Newton Gets an Update (109 points | 29 comments)
17. Deregulation in Argentina: Milei Takes "Deep Chainsaw" to Bureaucracy (8 points | 1 comment)
18. Gene drive modified mosquitoes offer new tool for malaria elimination efforts (13 points | 7 comments)
19. High‑dose Vitamin D reduces disease activity in early multiple sclerosis onset (24 points | 3 comments)
20. CO2 laser enables long-range detection of radioactive material (93 points | 18 comments)
21. Brain Scans of Infants Reveal the Moment We Start Making Memories (69 points | 33 comments)
22. Battling the Blaze: Artifacts from the history of firefighting (4 points | discuss)
23. I won't connect my dishwasher to your cloud (751 points | 487 comments)
24. A sodium-ion portable power bank comes to market (12 points | discuss)
25. The earliest versions of the first C compiler known to exist (347 points | 161 comments)
26. Why we chose LangGraph to build our coding agent (34 points | 7 comments)
27. Show HN: I'm a teacher and built an AI presentation tool (212 points | 88 comments)
28. MRubyD: A new mruby virtual machine implemented in pure C# (81 points | 22 comments)
29. Intel: A Bug and a Pro (61 points | 34 comments)
30. Can Parrot Brains Teach Us About Human Speech? (27 points | 2 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, March 25, 2025 at 12:35 PM UTC
